summary: Slide-in panel (drawer) that anchors to a side of the screen for off-canvas content.
recommendations: Use `anchor` (`left` | `right` | `top` | `bottom`) to control which edge the drawer slides in from — defaults to `right`.
Set `variant` to `temporary` for overlay drawers (backdrop + click-outside-to-close) or `persistent` for drawers that push content — defaults to `persistent`.
Provide `title` and optionally `description` to render a built-in `Header`; use `isHeaderCompact` for a condensed header variant.
Set `isHeaderSticky` to true to pin the header while the drawer body scrolls independently.
Enable `showCloseButton` to render an icon button in the top corner; pair with `onClose` to handle the close event.
Pass `zIndex` when nesting drawers or working alongside modals; if omitted the drawer defaults to z-index 1099.
For programmatic use (opening without direct JSX), prefer `DrawerService.open()` backed by a single `DrawerRoot` mounted at the app root.
The `onClose` callback receives a `ModalResponse<DrawerCloseResponse>` — check `reason` to distinguish backdrop-click from explicit close.
